intro: Comarostaphylis formosa, commonly known as the pink fairy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has delicate, fan-shaped leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in full sun and is popular in native gardens. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated for erosion control and habitat provision.
